metadata.name: Japan Briefing
metadata.description: Daily news briefing for the NYT Tokyo Bureau Chief

all.headline: 女子スロープS 深田茉莉が金 村瀬心椛が銅メダル【詳しく】
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スノーボード女子スロープスタイルで深田茉莉選手が金メダル、村瀬心椛選手が銅メダルを獲得しました。19歳の深田選手は、冬のオリンピックで日本女子最年少での金メダル獲得です。記事後半では1回目から3回目までの試合経過をお伝えしています。

all.headline: 第2次高市内閣が発足 新年度予算案の年度内成立に強い意欲
all.description: 第2次高市内閣が18日に発足し、高市総理大臣は、新年度予算案の年度内成立に強い意欲を示しました。「責任ある積極財政」など、内閣の重要政策の実現にスピード感を持って取り組む方針です。

all.headline: 対米投資 第2弾の選定作業 次世代型原子炉の建設などを検討
all.description: 日米合意に基づくアメリカへの投資をめぐり、日米両政府は18日、第1弾として3つのプロジェクトを選定しました。関係者によりますと、第2弾の選定作業に入っていてこれまでに次世代型の原子炉の建設などをめぐって、具体的な検討が進められていることが分かりました。

all.headline: “トランプ氏 近くイランに大規模攻撃の可能性” 米メディア
all.description: アメリカの一部のメディアは、トランプ大統領が近くイランに対して大規模な攻撃に踏み切る可能性があると報じました。一方、ホワイトハウスの報道官はイランとの高官協議について「まだ隔たりの大きい問題もあり、イラン側は数週間のうちにより詳細な提案を行うと見込まれている。大統領は今後の推移を注視していく」と述べ、イラン側に譲歩を求めました。

all.headline: 「iPS細胞」の再生医療製品 製造販売を了承するか きょう審議
all.description: 心臓病とパーキンソン病の治療のための「iPS細胞」を使った2つの再生医療製品について、19日、厚生労働省の専門家部会で、製造販売を了承するか、審議されます。世界初の実用化に向けて審議の結果が注目されます。

all.headline: 東北大など国立大3校 留学生の定員の上限緩和 文部科学省
all.description: 国際的に留学生の獲得競争が激しくなる中、文部科学省は、東北大学などの国立大学3校について、留学生の定員の上限を緩和し、受け入れを拡大させていくことを決めました。

all.headline: ミラノ・コルティナ五輪【結果】2/18～19 タイムライン
all.description: 冬季オリンピック、ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック。日本時間の2月18日から19日の動きをお伝えしています。スノーボード女子スロープスタイルで深田茉莉選手が金メダル、村瀬心椛選手が銅メダルを獲得しました。19歳の深田選手は、冬のオリンピックで日本女子最年少での金メダル獲得です。これでミラノ・コルティナオリンピックで日本が獲得した金メダルが、あわせて5個となり、過去最多の1998年の長野大会と並びまし

all.headline: Canada survives Olympic scare to advance to men's hockey semifinals
all.description: Canada slipped past Czechia in overtime thanks to the heroics of Mitch Marner and Nick Suzuki.

all.headline: ‘Rental Family’: Performance becomes perilously real in Hikari's 'love letter' to Japan
all.description: Though it leans into stereotypes, Hikari’s film finds emotional resonance in Brendan Fraser’s performance as a hired father.

all.headline: Japan's Mari Fukada wins gold in women's slopestyle
all.description: Zoi ​Sadowski ​Synnott, ‌the 2022 champion, took ‌silver for New ​Zealand, ​while ​Fukada's ⁠compatriot Kokomo Murase ​earned bronze.

all.headline: GSDF cancels Osprey dispatch to drill with U.S. in Okinawa
all.description: The cancellation is believed to reflect consideration for local residents' concerns.

all.headline: Japan's Taiga ‌Hasegawa takes silver in men's slopestyle behind China's Su Yiming
all.description: The medal builds on the record haul for Japanese snowboarders at the 2026 Winter Games.

all.headline: First Ramadan after truce brings flicker of joy to devastated Gaza
all.description: Nearly all of Gaza's 2.2 million residents were displaced at least once during the more than two years of war between Israel and Hamas.

all.headline: LDP busy educating dozens of Lower House rookies
all.description: The party leadership fears that a gaffe made by any of the 66 newcomers to the all-important lower chamber of parliament may deal a blow to the Takaichi administration.

all.headline: South Korea says civilians sent drones to North Korea four times, harming ties
all.description: The ​trio flew the aircraft between September and January.

all.headline: Australia faces rebuild after T20 World Cup flop
all.description: Mitchell Marsh's team was embarrassed by Zimbabwe and Sri Lanka before a washed-out match sealed its ​elimination on Tuesday.

all.headline: Defiant Sweden ready for blockbuster men's quarterfinal against U.S.
all.description: The team wearing the three crowns is grasping for more gold in an Olympic men's ice hockey showdown few expected this early.

all.headline: Director Naomi Kawase’s New Film Explores Heart Transplants in Japan, Production Involved Real Patients, Families
all.description: A film about the current state of heart transplant surgeries in Japan has been completed in cooperation with actual patients. Director Naomi Kawase’s new work, “Yakushima’s Illusion,” pursued realism

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Japan’s Mari Fukada Wins Gold in Women’s Snowboard Slopestyle; Japan’s Kokomo Murase in Bronze
all.description: MILAN — Mari Fukada, 19, won gold in the women’s snowboard slopestyle on Wednesday in the Milano Cortina Olympic Games.

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Japan’s Taiga Hasegawa Wins Silver in Men’s Snowboard Slopestyle
all.description: MILAN — Taiga Hasegawa won silver in the men’s snowboard slopestyle on Wednesday in the Milano Cortina Olympic Games. It was the first Japanese medal for this event.

all.headline: Survey Shows False Election Info Perceived as True
all.description: TOKYO (Jiji Press) — False information spread during the campaign for the Feb. 8 general election was perceived as true by about 80% of voters who encountered it, according to a university survey.

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Japan’s Noake Makes Olympic Debut, Helps Speed Skating Squad Clinch Bronze in Women’s Team Pursuit
all.description: MILAN — The Japanese speed skating team fell short of the women’s team pursuit gold it had envisioned, but the women fought back to claim bronze at the Milano Cortina Olympics on Tuesday.

all.headline: Sanae Takaichi Elected 105th Prime Minister of Japan; Keeps All Cabinet Appointees from Previous Term
all.description: Sanae Takaichi was elected as the 105th Prime Minister at a special Diet session Wednesday. She was to form her second Cabinet that evening, reappointing all ministers from her first Cabinet after the

all.headline: Japan’s Govt to Submit Road Map for Growth Strategy in March, PM Takaichi to Announce in Upcoming Policy Speech
all.description: Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi is expected to announce in her policy speech on Friday that the government will present a public-private investment road map for its growth strategy in March, promoting b

all.headline: LDP Begins Training New Lawmakers to Avoid Scandal, Gaffes; Historic Victory in Latest Election Heightens Focus on Party
all.description: The Liberal Democratic Party has launched a rookie education program, holding a training session this week for new LDP lawmakers who were just elected to the House of Representatives.

all.headline: Transport Companies See Opportunity in Narita Expansion; Airlines, Railways Prepare to Meet Expected Growth in Demand
all.description: Major airline and railway companies are now hurrying to plan their responses to the 2029 expansion of Narita airport, which they view as a premier business opportunity.

all.headline: Riku-Ryu Pair Wins Gold Medal: Their Strong Bond Leads to Major Comeback Victory
all.description: Spontaneous applause erupted from the arena and teammates who were cheering on the pair shed tears. It was a breathtaking performance and comeback victory that enveloped the audience in profound emoti

all.headline: Australia bans citizen trying to return from IS camp in Syria
all.description: The person temporarily banned is among a group of 34 who this week attempted to leave the camp for Australia.

all.headline: Indian university faces backlash for claiming Chinese robodog as own at AI summit
all.description: A professor claimed that a robotic dog made by Chinese firm Unitree had been made by the university.

all.headline: Long queues and confusion mar first day of India's landmark AI summit
all.description: The India-AI Impact Summit 2026 in Delhi is expected to be attended by top tech leaders from the world.

all.headline: Lunar New Year 2026: Celebrations around the world
all.description: Millions of people around the world are celebrating the start of the Lunar New Year, with festivities taking place from Hong Kong to Buenos Aires.

all.headline: Dual nationals face scramble for UK passports as new rules come into force
all.description: Entry requirements to the UK for dual nationals are being overhauled as part of sweeping changes to the immigration system.

all.headline: Ex-winger Utai in serious condition after shooting
all.description: Former NRL star Matt Utai is in a "critical condition" after being shot multiple times outside his home in Sydney, Australia.

all.headline: China is hitting Japan where it hurts. Will PM Takaichi give in?
all.description: From recalling pandas to cancelling tourist flights, China continues to retaliate after Takaichi's comments on Taiwan.

all.headline: 'Dragged out and set on fire' - the Bangladesh mob killing that shocked the world
all.description: In December, Hindu factory worker Dipu Das was lynched in Bangladesh, igniting global outrage.

all.headline: Sydney police plead for return of man, 85, kidnapped by mistake
all.description: Police say they're 'a million percent confident' Chris Baghsarian was not the intended target.

all.headline: How Indonesia's new sex laws will affect tourists
all.description: International travelers have been flocking back to the popular resort island of Bali as the Covid pandemic subsides, prompting hopes that Indonesia's battered tourism industry is on the road to recove

all.headline: Afghanistan
North Korea
This 'edible' plastic bag alternative could save Nara's sacred deer
all.description: A local entrepreneur in the Japanese tourist destination of Nara has developed an alternative to plastic shopping bags, to protect the town's sacred deer.

all.headline: The battle to save Sri Lanka's leopards
all.description: Having endured a bloody civil war from 1983 until 2009, Sri Lanka is now at peace and developing rapidly. That's good news for the country as a whole, but the island nation's leopards are under threat

all.headline: Wildlife is flourishing around Fukushima
all.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

all.headline: China debuts 620 kph train prototype
all.description: China has revealed a prototype for a new high-speed Maglev train that is capable of reaching speeds of 620 kilometers (385 miles) per hour.

all.headline: A Shanghai building 'walks' to a new location
all.description: Shanghai residents passing through the city's eastern Huangpu district in October might have stumbled upon an unusual sight: a "walking" building.

all.headline: Self-driving robotaxis are taking off in China
all.description: The world has been inching toward fully autonomous cars for years. In China, one company just got even closer to making it a reality.

all.headline: Travel to Japan during Covid-19: What you need to know
all.description: If you're planning a trip to Japan, here's what you'll need to know and expect if you want to visit during the global coronavirus pandemic.

competitors.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

primary.headline: 女子スロープS 深田茉莉が金 村瀬心椛が銅メダル【詳しく】
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スノーボード女子スロープスタイルで深田茉莉選手が金メダル、村瀬心椛選手が銅メダルを獲得しました。19歳の深田選手は、冬のオリンピックで日本女子最年少での金メダル獲得です。記事後半では1回目から3回目までの試合経過をお伝えしています。

primary.headline: 第2次高市内閣が発足 新年度予算案の年度内成立に強い意欲
primary.description: 第2次高市内閣が18日に発足し、高市総理大臣は、新年度予算案の年度内成立に強い意欲を示しました。「責任ある積極財政」など、内閣の重要政策の実現にスピード感を持って取り組む方針です。

primary.headline: 対米投資 第2弾の選定作業 次世代型原子炉の建設などを検討
primary.description: 日米合意に基づくアメリカへの投資をめぐり、日米両政府は18日、第1弾として3つのプロジェクトを選定しました。関係者によりますと、第2弾の選定作業に入っていてこれまでに次世代型の原子炉の建設などをめぐって、具体的な検討が進められていることが分かりました。

primary.headline: “トランプ氏 近くイランに大規模攻撃の可能性” 米メディア
primary.description: アメリカの一部のメディアは、トランプ大統領が近くイランに対して大規模な攻撃に踏み切る可能性があると報じました。一方、ホワイトハウスの報道官はイランとの高官協議について「まだ隔たりの大きい問題もあり、イラン側は数週間のうちにより詳細な提案を行うと見込まれている。大統領は今後の推移を注視していく」と述べ、イラン側に譲歩を求めました。

primary.headline: 「iPS細胞」の再生医療製品 製造販売を了承するか きょう審議
primary.description: 心臓病とパーキンソン病の治療のための「iPS細胞」を使った2つの再生医療製品について、19日、厚生労働省の専門家部会で、製造販売を了承するか、審議されます。世界初の実用化に向けて審議の結果が注目されます。

primary.headline: 東北大など国立大3校 留学生の定員の上限緩和 文部科学省
primary.description: 国際的に留学生の獲得競争が激しくなる中、文部科学省は、東北大学などの国立大学3校について、留学生の定員の上限を緩和し、受け入れを拡大させていくことを決めました。

primary.headline: ミラノ・コルティナ五輪【結果】2/18～19 タイムライン
primary.description: 冬季オリンピック、ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック。日本時間の2月18日から19日の動きをお伝えしています。スノーボード女子スロープスタイルで深田茉莉選手が金メダル、村瀬心椛選手が銅メダルを獲得しました。19歳の深田選手は、冬のオリンピックで日本女子最年少での金メダル獲得です。これでミラノ・コルティナオリンピックで日本が獲得した金メダルが、あわせて5個となり、過去最多の1998年の長野大会と並びまし

primary.headline: Canada survives Olympic scare to advance to men's hockey semifinals
primary.description: Canada slipped past Czechia in overtime thanks to the heroics of Mitch Marner and Nick Suzuki.

primary.headline: ‘Rental Family’: Performance becomes perilously real in Hikari's 'love letter' to Japan
primary.description: Though it leans into stereotypes, Hikari’s film finds emotional resonance in Brendan Fraser’s performance as a hired father.

primary.headline: Japan's Mari Fukada wins gold in women's slopestyle
primary.description: Zoi ​Sadowski ​Synnott, ‌the 2022 champion, took ‌silver for New ​Zealand, ​while ​Fukada's ⁠compatriot Kokomo Murase ​earned bronze.

primary.headline: GSDF cancels Osprey dispatch to drill with U.S. in Okinawa
primary.description: The cancellation is believed to reflect consideration for local residents' concerns.

primary.headline: Japan's Taiga ‌Hasegawa takes silver in men's slopestyle behind China's Su Yiming

primary.headline: First Ramadan after truce brings flicker of joy to devastated Gaza
primary.description: Nearly all of Gaza's 2.2 million residents were displaced at least once during the more than two years of war between Israel and Hamas.

primary.headline: LDP busy educating dozens of Lower House rookies
primary.description: The party leadership fears that a gaffe made by any of the 66 newcomers to the all-important lower chamber of parliament may deal a blow to the Takaichi administration.

primary.headline: South Korea says civilians sent drones to North Korea four times, harming ties
primary.description: The ​trio flew the aircraft between September and January.

primary.headline: Australia faces rebuild after T20 World Cup flop
primary.description: Mitchell Marsh's team was embarrassed by Zimbabwe and Sri Lanka before a washed-out match sealed its ​elimination on Tuesday.

primary.headline: Defiant Sweden ready for blockbuster men's quarterfinal against U.S.
primary.description: The team wearing the three crowns is grasping for more gold in an Olympic men's ice hockey showdown few expected this early.

primary.headline: Director Naomi Kawase’s New Film Explores Heart Transplants in Japan, Production Involved Real Patients, Families
primary.description: A film about the current state of heart transplant surgeries in Japan has been completed in cooperation with actual patients. Director Naomi Kawase’s new work, “Yakushima’s Illusion,” pursued realism

primary.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Japan’s Mari Fukada Wins Gold in Women’s Snowboard Slopestyle; Japan’s Kokomo Murase in Bronze
primary.description: MILAN — Mari Fukada, 19, won gold in the women’s snowboard slopestyle on Wednesday in the Milano Cortina Olympic Games.

primary.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Japan’s Taiga Hasegawa Wins Silver in Men’s Snowboard Slopestyle
primary.description: MILAN — Taiga Hasegawa won silver in the men’s snowboard slopestyle on Wednesday in the Milano Cortina Olympic Games. It was the first Japanese medal for this event.

primary.headline: Survey Shows False Election Info Perceived as True
primary.description: TOKYO (Jiji Press) — False information spread during the campaign for the Feb. 8 general election was perceived as true by about 80% of voters who encountered it, according to a university survey.

primary.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Japan’s Noake Makes Olympic Debut, Helps Speed Skating Squad Clinch Bronze in Women’s Team Pursuit
primary.description: MILAN — The Japanese speed skating team fell short of the women’s team pursuit gold it had envisioned, but the women fought back to claim bronze at the Milano Cortina Olympics on Tuesday.

primary.headline: Sanae Takaichi Elected 105th Prime Minister of Japan; Keeps All Cabinet Appointees from Previous Term
primary.description: Sanae Takaichi was elected as the 105th Prime Minister at a special Diet session Wednesday. She was to form her second Cabinet that evening, reappointing all ministers from her first Cabinet after the

primary.description: Major airline and railway companies are now hurrying to plan their responses to the 2029 expansion of Narita airport, which they view as a premier business opportunity.

screenshots.name: Takaichi Sanae
tweets:
The 221st special session of the Diet was convened today, and I will continue to take on important responsibilities as the 105th Prime Minister. This is the start of "Takauchikaku 2.0."

120 days ago, there were 237 votes in the House of Representatives leadership nomination election.
The government was formed on a treadmill with just four votes above the majority.

Congratulations to the women's speed skating team pursuit athletes for winning the bronze medal at the Milan-Cortina Olympics!
They cut through the wind in perfect formation, a ski that can be described as Japan's ``special skill,'' and this was a valuable medal win for the Japanese women's pursuit world for the third time in a row.

Recently, Japan and the United States agreed on the first project of the "Strategic Investment Initiative," which was agreed upon based on the Japan-U.S. Tariff Consultation.

The first project is
① A project to manufacture industrial artificial diamonds used in the processing of parts and materials for automobiles, aircraft, and semiconductors, in which both Japan and the United States are highly dependent on specific countries.

Congratulations to the figure skating pair Riki Miura and Ryuichi Kihara for winning the gold medal at the Milan-Cortina Olympics!

The two, affectionately known as ``Rikuryu'', showed an incredible comeback, bouncing back from adversity with perfect performance and breaking the record for the highest score in the free skate.
We welcomed everyone involved in Ibaraki Prefecture's "Mt. Tsukuba Plum Festival," "Tsuchiura Lotus Roots," and "Koga Peach Festival" to the Prime Minister's Office.
